meanings.definition: A loud, deep sound or noise.
meanings.sent1: The whoomp of the thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: I heard a whoomp coming from the basement.
meanings.sent3: The whoomp of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The whoomp of the waterfall filled the valley with its power.
meanings.sent5: The whoomp of the drum echoed through the room, setting the rhythm for the dance.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with force.
meanings.sent1: He whoomped the ball with all his might, sending it flying.
meanings.sent2: She whoomped the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The chef whoomped the dough to make the perfect pizza crust.
meanings.sent4: The boxer whoomped his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter whoomped the nail into the wood with a single strike.

meanings.definition: A sudden, forceful movement or action.
meanings.sent1: The whoomp of the door slamming shut startled me.
meanings.sent2: The whoomp of the car engine starting broke the silence of the night.
meanings.sent3: The whoomp of the cat pouncing on the toy was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The whoomp of the tree falling in the forest echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The whoomp of the hammer hitting the nail signaled the beginning of the construction work.
